intro: Nassauvia modesta, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Nassauvia modesta is also noted for its milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in its family.
